The claim was made by Gov: Terry McAuliffe during a seminar and on his monthly radio show, providing a clear source of the statement.
The official source for Virginia school: the Superintendent's Annual Report, was consulted to verify the claim.
The start date for the claim was clarifi: McAuliffe's director of communications, to refer to the state budget year that began July 1, 2007, and ended June 30, 2008.
Data from the Superintendent: s Annual Report showed a decline in full-time equivalent jobs in Virginia public schools from 191,013 in 2007-08 to 186,202 in 2013-14, supporting the claim of job cuts.
